HTML.Description: A skill tree covering various aspects of HTML mastery.

HTML Basics.Description: Covers the foundational elements of HTML.

Attributes.Description: Proper use of attributes: id, class, href, src, alt.

Nesting.Description: Nesting elements correctly and understanding document flow.

Text Formatting.Description: Working with basic text formatting tags: <b>, <i>, <u>, <strong>, <em>.

Semantic HTML.Description: Focuses on writing meaningful and structured HTML.

Purpose of Semantic Tags.Description: Understanding the purpose of semantic tags.

Layout Design.Description: Designing a layout with semantic meaning in mind.

Forms and Validations.Description: Focuses on creating and validating forms.

Form Attributes.Description: Working with form attributes: action, method, target, autocomplete.

Input Types.Description: Understanding input types: text, password, email, number, date, file, checkbox, radio.

Validation Attributes.Description: Utilizing form validation attributes: required, pattern, min, max, maxlength, step.

Accessible Forms.Description: Building forms with accessible error messages and labels.

Accessibility.Description: Ensures web content is accessible to all users.

Alternative Text.Description: Adding alternative text to images (alt attribute).

Screen Readers.Description: Structuring content for screen readers with role and ARIA attributes.

Navigation Techniques.Description: Using accessible navigation techniques: tabindex, skip links.

Focus States.Description: Creating focus states and ensuring keyboard navigability.

Content Readability.Description: Structuring content for readability with proper heading levels and landmarks.

Media Integration.Description: Focuses on integrating and optimizing media content.

Embedding Images.Description: Embedding images with and understanding responsive images: srcset, sizes.

Media Performance.Description: Understanding the implications of media performance (lazy loading, formats).

SEO Fundamentals.Description: Covers foundational techniques for search engine optimization.

Headings.Description: Using headings <h1>-<h6> properly for content hierarchy.

Canonical URLs.Description: Creating canonical URLs and avoiding duplicate content issues.

Metadata.Description: Adding Open Graph and Twitter Card metadata.

Structured Data.Description: Using structured data (<script type="application/ld+json">) for rich results.

Advanced HTML Techniques.Description: Explores advanced concepts and techniques in HTML.

Templates and Slots.Description: Creating and using <template> and <slot> for web components.

Dialogs.Description: Using <dialog> for modals and interactive elements.

Shadow DOM.Description: Understanding shadow DOM and encapsulation basics.

Progressive Enhancement.Description: Applying best practices for future-proof HTML.

CSS.Description: A skill tree covering mastery of CSS for web design and development.

CSS Basics.Description: Covers the foundational elements of CSS.

Syntax.Description: Understanding the syntax: selectors, properties, and values.

Basic Selectors.Description: Using basic selectors: type, class, ID, universal (*)

Common Properties.Description: Applying common properties: color, background-color, font-size, margin, padding, border.

Box Model.Description: Understanding the box model (content, padding, border, margin).

Linking CSS.Description: Linking CSS to HTML using <link> and <style>.
